name: cozy sporty socks
sizes_available: small 7in circumference (56 sts), medium 8in circumference (64 sts), large 9in circumference (72 sts)
notes:
each year, i knit socks for my family.  i love using leftover yarn and every year i think of a different way to use it.  i wanted to share this yearâ€™s recipe with you all and i hope it makes you and your loved ones happy!

enjoy this free pattern!

this pattern is written as a top/cuff down construction.


yarn and notions:

yarn:  100g fingering weight yarn  (350-425 yards / 320-390 metres) total
*(i suggest 50-70 g of a main colour and 10-15g of each contrasting colour)
samples in leftovers of super sock (75% merino 25% nylon) by tippy tree yarns

needles: 
2.25 mm needles with a long cable for magic loop

other notions: stitch markers, scissors, darning needle

gauge: 8-9 sts = 1 inch / 2.5cm in ribbing with the smaller needles (2.25 mm)

sizes: (*choose a size that is slightly smaller than your foot circumference for a snug fit)
small, 56 sts, finished circumference 7 inches
medium, 64 sts, finished circumference 8 inches
large, 72 sts, finished circumference 9 inches

notes:

the instructions are written for 3 colours. you may of course decide to knit these socks in only one colour by simply ignoring the instructions for colour changes. you can also use just one contrasting colour, or even multiple colours, as you prefer!
